alert.note: Alert for Sherburne; Stearns; Wright (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 11:00AM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River near Jordan affecting Carver, Scott and Sibley Counties. ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in Minnesota... South Fork Crow River below Mayer affecting Carver County. Mississippi River at Fridley abv 37th Ave NE affecting Hennepin and Anoka Counties. Mississippi River at St. Cloud affecting Stearns, Sherburne and Wright Counties. .Widespread flooding continues on area rivers. Up to a half-inch of additional rainfall through Friday morning is expected to prolong high river flows through the end of this week. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Mississippi River at St. Cloud. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 945 AM CDT Thursday, the stage was 9.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 945 AM CDT Thursday was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.0 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.8 feet on 03/30/2009. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
